definition: to fight counterfeiting/to expose as false/to denounce sb's lies
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Fighting against false is always a kind of group behaving, including fighting against false news.
sentences.chinese: 打假永遠是一種羣體行爲，新聞打假概莫能外。

sentences.english: Fighting against false is always a kind of group behaving, including fighting against false news.
sentences.chinese: 打假永遠是一種羣體行爲，新聞打假概莫能外。

sentences.english: Several people in the crowd seemed to be fighting.
sentences.chinese: 人羣中好像有好幾個人在打假。

sentences.english: Attacked fraud busters awarded only 2600 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 打假鬥士方舟子被襲只獲2600元賠償。

sentences.english: How to prevent and treat the falsification have been the focus of the society.
sentences.chinese: 如何防假和打假成爲當前社會各界共同關注的焦點。

sentences.english: China's e-commerce boom has given counterfeit hunters a new front.
sentences.chinese: 中國的電子商務繁榮給打假者帶來了新的陣地。

sentences.english: Alibaba has also defended Tmall's efforts to fight fakes.
sentences.chinese: 阿里巴巴也爲天貓的打假行動進行了辯護。

sentences.english: Anti-counterfeit initiatives with this misplaced focus are growing fast.
sentences.chinese: 這類焦點錯位的打假行動正在迅速增長。

definition: (of a business operator) to inflate one's reputation by dishonest means (e.g. posting fake reviews)
to generate fake transactions in order to game a commercial online platform (one that rewards users who make numerous transactions)
to crack down on/to take severe measures against
to counterfeit/to pass off a fake as genuine
to impersonate/to pose as (someone else)/to counterfeit/to palm off (a fake as a genuine)
(Internet slang) to mouth off/to shoot one's mouth off/sb who does that
